channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Periods: Festivals need facilities at live events, says singer
item.description: Having a period at festivals can be dehumanising due to a lack of facilities, festival-goers say.

item.title: 'No answers' decade after Glyn Summers' Spanish fall death
item.description: Glyn Summers, 17, was on an educational trip to Spain when he fell from a hotel balcony.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: 'Inspirational US Open champion creating tennis buzz'
item.description: Emma Raducanu's former coach says the new US Open champion is attracting youngers to play tennis.

item.title: Ferraris sale worth £8.5m help fund Pwllheli RNLI boathouse
item.description: Legacy gift from classic car enthusiast pays for new state-of-the-art lifeboat base.

item.title: Porthcawl man seriously hurt after fight at seaside resort
item.description: A 33-year-old is in a serious condition in hospital after an early hours fight near a beach.

item.title: Woman airlifted to hospital in rescue operation after cliff fall
item.description: A doctor had to be helped down the cliff to treat the woman, who had multiple injuries.

item.title: Craig Bellamy: Ex-Liverpool striker leaves Anderlecht over depression
item.description: Former Wales and Liverpool striker Craig Bellamy leaves his role as Anderlecht assistant manager to deal with depression.

item.title: Tributes left at scene after man's body found in Flint
item.description: Detectives have warned an extra police presence will remain as they investigate the man's death.

item.title: Hospital pressure to continue for a month, health minister says
item.description: The prediction comes as a further eight deaths and 2,317 new Covid cases are recorded in Wales.

item.title: Covid: Travellers from Wales can soon use private PCR tests
item.description: There was criticism people in Wales had to pay for NHS tests while those in England could "shop around".

item.title: Inquest delays: Three-year wait for answers over death of girl, 4
item.description: Skyla Whiting died with sepsis days after becoming unwell with an upset tummy in May 2018.

item.title: Finsbury Park mosque attacker fears eye loss after prison stabbing
item.description: The Finsbury Park mosque attacker was stabbed by an inmate while serving a life sentence for murder.

item.title: Festivals: Period facilities are needed at live events
item.description: Menstruating at lives event can be "dehumanising and daunting", festival-goers say.

item.title: Stereophonics: Cardiff gig resale ticket prices 'annoying' for band
item.description: The Welsh rockers urge fans to avoid secondary resale sites for their Christmas shows in Cardiff.

item.title: Afghan refugees 'leave everything behind and have nothing'
item.description: Wales' Afghan community have been collecting clothes, shoes, toys and nappies for children.

item.title: Covid in Wales: No vaccine passports needed for public services
item.description: The Welsh government is considering whether vaccine passports should be introduced in some settings.

item.title: Endometriosis: 'I thought I would die from period blood loss'
item.description: Anna Cooper was told was nothing wrong but has now had 13 surgeries due to endometriosis.

item.title: Pontypridd market street food Michelin-star chefs for food gong
item.description: Janet Wei beat some chefs who worked in Michelin-star restaurants to claim the title.

item.title: Nottingham Forest 1-2 Cardiff City: Colwill leads Cardiff comeback
item.description: Teenager Rubin Colwill scores twice as Cardiff City come from behind to claim victory and keep Nottingham Forest winless and bottom of the Championship.

item.title: Dragons beat Wasps, Cardiff see off Bath and Ospreys lose at Northampton after Scarlets win at Leicester in warm-ups
item.description: Dragons conclude the Welsh regions' pre-season games with a 31-24 win at Wasps after Cardiff beat Bath, Ospreys lost at Northampton and Scarlets won at Leicester.

item.title: World Cup of Darts: Wales' Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton lose in semi-finals
item.description: Wales' Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton are unable to defend their World Cup of Darts title as they lose to Scotland in the semi-finals.

item.title: County Championship: Price is right as Gloucestershire peg back Glamorgan
item.description: Glamorgan reach 264-6 against Gloucestershire, with Tom Price claiming 3-44 and David Lloyd top-scoring with 73 on a see-saw day in Cardiff.

item.title: Cardiff Devils: Home and away pre-season victories over Nottingham Panthers
item.description: Cardiff Devils enjoyed a 5-1 victory at home and 4-2 win on the road in weekend Elite League warm-up games against Nottingham Panthers.

item.title: 'Dim atebion' ddegawd wedi marwolaeth Glyn Summers
item.description: Roedd Glyn Summers, 17, ar drip addysgol yn Sbaen pan gwympodd oddi ar falconi gwesty yn Barcelona.

item.title: 'Angen gwell adnoddau misglwyf mewn gwyliau cerddorol'
item.description: Mae'r berfformwraig, Francesca Dimech, yn dweud bod gwyliau cerddorol 'yn anodd' i ferched adeg eu misglwyf.

item.title: Hydrogen: Cyfle i greu miloedd o swyddi i Gymru
item.description: Gobaith y gallai datblygiadau ynni hydrogen ddod â'r un budd i'r economi ac y gwnaeth olew a nwy yn y gorffennol.

item.title: Oriel: Ras fynydd 'anoddaf yn y byd'
item.description: Dim ond chwarter o gystadleuwyr Ras Cefn y Ddraig orffennodd y ras - a does ryfedd o weld y lluniau yma!

item.title: Diwrnod 1: Morgannwg 246-6 yn erbyn Caerloyw
item.description: Morgannwg 246-6 yn erbyn Caerloyw ym Mhencampwriaeth y Siroedd ar ddiwedd y diwrnod cyntaf.
